title: Hextech chests are easier to get than keys...and why that's bad
body:
I've already earned 5 Hextech chests so far this season but I've only gotten 8 key fragments (translating into 2 keys.)  I haven't received a single key fragment in my last dozen wins.  Meanwhile, the first day I have a new chest available I'm able to get an S rating within a couple games.

Riot Wingfield in another post said:
> [{quoted}](name=Wingfield,realm=NA,application-id=LqLKtMpN,discussion-id=rJ4rQmHA,comment-id=0006,timestamp=2016-03-22T20:49:01.290+0000)
>
> Hey all,
> 
> Just want to help clarify some things about key drop rates:
> 
> Key drop rates are NOT linear and only wins have a chance of dropping a key. So you will earn key fragments much faster in your earlier wins than you will in your later wins. Or said another way, each incremental key fragment drop is harder than the last (on average... there is variance). This resets on a monthly basis for each player individually. The goal is to create a nice ebb and flow.
> 
> Grade does NOT impact key drop chance.
> 
> Premades DO increase drop chance.
> 
> Chests earned has no impact on key drop chance.
> 
> There is variance and randomness (with limits).  It's unlikely that what happened to your friend will happen to you.
> 
> Hope that helps clarify :)

Source: http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/bug-report/rJ4rQmHA-after-getting-4-chests-key-fragments-no-longer-seem-to-drop-for-a-lot-of-people?comment=0006

This is a horrible, horrible idea.  This hextech crafting system was supposed to be about rewarding positive members of the community with rewards for **PLAYER PERFORMANCE**.  The hard part about the system was supposed to be getting the S rating for the champion, not mindlessly grinding games to get key fragments.  Yes, I understand the decayed of key fragment drops will reset every month.  However, as it stands right now with the key fragments dropping less and less the more keys you get it takes away all the sense of accomplishment of getting an S rating with the champion because I know I'll have to grind 30+ games in order to get enough key fragments to open the damn box.  Its like "Yay!  Another box!  Guess I'll have to cross my fingers and hope I maybe get ONE key fragment in my next dozen wins!"

What's in the box!  Just freaking tell me what's in the box!  A skin? A champion? Gwyneth Paltrow's head?  What's in the box!

I guess I'll never know since I'll have to play an exponential amount of games to open the damn thing since I sure as hell am not going to fork over more RP for this stuff.

EDIT: I realized I should provide a solution, not just state the problem.  I propose that in addition to getting random key fragment drops if you achieve an S rating with a champion and you do not have any chests available you instead receive a key fragment.  This would solve the issue of people "getting unlucky" with drops and also give you a reward if you get an S rating when you don't have a chest available.

EDIT 2: I'm all for exploring how much higher the drop rate for keys is with a premade.  If any of you want to group up add me in game.

Make it so you can earn one chest per champion per month for s games and afterwards make it so you earn chest fragments for S games for repeat play with champions. 

This will effectively accomplish multiple things. 

1. You won't get penalized for playing your favorite champions over and over.. You will earn the rewards at a diminished rate. I'm thinking 1/2 of a chest for the 2nd and 3rd S game you get and then 1/4th of a chest from then on.. Resetting every month. 

2. This will encourage players to work toward 3 s games with each champion every month. Thus diversifying the meta a little more. Players with limited number of champions will be encouraged to play more and buy more champions. 

3. Free rotation champions will be locked to a 1/4th of a chest ratio unless you own that champion. Giving new player something to shoot for 

Simply adjust the chest rewards accordingly based on this rate of dispersion and there you go. 

The players will be happier and Riot won't look like a bunch of douches following every other freemium game model out there that everyone hates.

any tips on earning chests?

Looking at your stats the thing that's holding you back is your cs/min. When I've gotten an S on junglers I usually have at least 4 cs/min and when I'm on laners I have no less than 6 cs/min (usually 7-9 cs/min.) And on top of that high cs you also need to have typically 4 or less deaths and also have a decent number of kills and assists. If you're a damage dealer you also usually need to have the highest damage on your team and if you're a tank you need to have the highest damage taken.

I recommend going into custom games and working on your jungle clear and also working on your last hitting in lane. A lot of it is just experience. I used to think getting above 3 cs/min as a jungler was impossible and now I can get 5 or more without too much trouble.
